meanings.definition: To make something dirty or stained.
meanings.sent1: The muddy dog was soiling the clean carpet.
meanings.sent2: Please be careful not to soil your clothes while playing outside.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous toddler enjoyed soiling his hands with paint.
meanings.sent4: The rain continued soiling the once pristine streets.
meanings.sent5: The careless chef accidentally started soiling the kitchen floor with flour.

meanings.definition: The act of making something dirty or stained.
meanings.sent1: The soiling of the white shirt was hard to remove.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the soiling on the walls and decided to clean them.
meanings.sent3: The soiling on the picnic blanket was a reminder of the fun day out.
meanings.sent4: The soiling on the document made it difficult to read the text.
meanings.sent5: The soiling on the car's exterior was evidence of a long journey.
